node.title: CBS News Host Confronts Ted Cruz Over 'Big Lie,' 2020 Election Challenge in Tense Interview
node.description: A new book claims Cruz had conversations with Trump on January 6 and knew Congress lacked the authority to overturn the 2020 presidential election.

node.title: Buzz off — getting ready for mosquito 'explosion'
node.description: Mosquitoes love the kind of weather Australia is offering at the moment and look set for a bumper summer. Here's why breeding conditions are ideal and the best way to prepare.

node.title: 101-year old Irene credits her longevity to plain food, but draws the line at bread and dripping
node.description: The fiercely independent centenarian credits her longevity to a good diet, and says visits from Meals on Wheels ensure she's never lonely.

node.title: Meet the women lighting a path in male-dominated industries
node.description: Chanelle Olive was just like many teenage girls, unsure what path to take as she was graduating from high school. A chance meeting changed everything for her.

node.title: Queensland mandates PCR tests, but who should pay? D'Ath says the Commonwealth
node.description: In a matter of weeks, Queensland will require new arrivals to take a PCR test within 72 hours of entry. But it's still not clear who will pay for it. Even less clear is what the changes mean for border residents.

node.title: Queen marks first wedding anniversary without Prince Philip
node.description: Queen Elizabeth II has marked her first wedding anniversary alone, seven months after the death of her husband of 73 years, Prince Philip.

node.title: Purr-fect holiday for pet owners in peril
node.description: The borders around Auckland will officially lift on 15 December and residents are champing at the bit to visit friends and family across the country for Christmas. But what about those family members… Audio

node.title: Some octopuses are smarter than others — and hunt in packs
node.description: Researchers identify differences in the brains of four octopus species and find some are smarter than others and able to make connections outside their own species.

node.title: From terminator to germinator: Find out how these farmers are helping Australia reach net zero
node.description: When Joe Vaughan started his vineyard, he approached farming like a battlefield — killing unwanted pests and plants. Now he is among a growing number of farmers promoting life through regenerative agriculture.

node.title: Facebook gives users 'more control' over news feed
node.description: Facebook says it is introducing new features to give people more control over what appears in their news feeds.

node.title: Man U sack Solskjaer as City win again
node.description: Manchester United have sacked manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, a day after a defeat by Watford left the club seventh in the Premier League.

node.title: High cost of building supplies for residential housing investigated
node.description: Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs David Clark says there have been long-standing concerns about whether there is enough competition in the sector.

node.title: NAACP president says Rittenhouse trial was a "warning shot" on "vigilante justice"
node.description: "It's hard for African-Americans to reconcile what we witnessed in that trial," Derrick Johnson said.

node.title: Facebook group 'seeing laugh reacts on death' as COVID misinformation spreads
node.description: COVID-19 has intensified misinformation and community polarisation along issues like vaccination, but it's a symptom of a broader problem facing social media.

node.title: SA Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman steps down pending investigation
node.description: South Australia's Deputy Premier steps down from her ministerial roles, pending the outcome of an ombudsman's inquiry into her decision to knock back a seaport on Kangaroo Island.

node.title: Missing tennis star Peng Shuai says she 'wants her privacy respected' in video call with IOC president
node.description: After concerns for her safety following her sexual assault allegation against a former Communist Party official, the International Olympic Committee says Ms Peng has told its president that she is "safe and well".

node.title: Warnings mount over health system's ability to cope with more Covid-19 cases
node.description: There are 289 Intensive Care Unit or High Dependency Unit beds at the moment, with Minister of Health Andrew Little insisting that could be ramped up to 550 if needed.

node.title: Covid-19 shots on the menu at Wairarapa pub
node.description: The MidCentral District Health Board and local iwi are running mobile vaccination clinics to ensure people who can't get to town easily can still be vaccinated.

node.title: Cruz says there's reason to be "deeply, deeply skeptical" about Peng Shuai's reappearance
node.description: Cruz told "Face the Nation" the Chinese government is "trying to pretend everything is OK."

node.title: Covid-19 surge strains Michigan’s hospitals.
node.description: Staffing shortages and pandemic fatigue add to complications.

node.title: Shared e-scooters locked out of Brisbane party districts after midnight in six-month trial
node.description: Shared e-scooters will be locked from midnight to 5am on weekends in Brisbane's CBD and Fortitude Valley in a six-month safety trial from December 1.

node.title: Community reels as investigators piece together tragic fire that tore through Werribee home
node.description: Neighbours shed tears and firefighters looked visibly shaken after a blaze in Melbourne's west in the early hours of Sunday morning resulted in the deaths of four children.

node.title: Gottlieb says COVID-19 vaccines could be considered a "three-dose vaccine"
node.description: He said the CDC is currently "sort of stuttering" on making that recommendation because of the "debate" in the public health community about whether younger people who are at a lower risk level to get COVID-19 should get a third dose.

node.title: Review: The Met Opera’s Next ‘Ring’ Will Be a Sea Change
node.description: Richard Jones’s bleak staging of Wagner’s “Die Walküre” in London offers a clean break from the extravagance of the Met’s most recent production.

node.title: Disney puts worker vaccine mandate on pause after Florida ban on restrictions.
node.description: Iconic brand runs into political headwinds over the pandemic response.

node.title: With Back Channels to Manchin and Sinema, Pelosi Found a Path to a Deal
node.description: The House’s approval of a sweeping social policy bill after weeks of fits and starts notched another win for the speaker in a career defined by them.

node.title: Police Officer Fired Over $25 Donation to Kyle Rittenhouse Demands Job Back After Verdict
node.description: "If I had a different opinion and I donated to a fund for the victims and made comments about how Mr. Rittenhouse was a murderer, nobody would have cared or tried to get me fired," said William Kelly.

node.title: AFL draft top 30: Ranking the best talents in this year's crop
node.description: With the AFL draft just around the corner, check out our rankings of the best 30 young players available to find out who is really the cream of the crop.

node.title: For real life! New Bluey episodes are out this week. Here's when to watch
node.description: There's new games to play with Mum and Dad, and some lessons to be learned along the way for Bluey and her sister Bingo in season three.

node.title: Cashing in: ASX fuels billions of dollars of wealth through floats in 2021
node.description: Why are so many companies listing on the ASX, who is benefiting and what exactly is involved in an initial public offering anyway?
